headline: Will TI’s Afero IoT Push and New Auto Chips Reframe Texas Instruments' (TXN) Innovation Narrative?
summary: Afero recently announced a past collaboration with Texas Instruments to pair TI’s first Wi‑Fi microcontrollers for IoT with Afero’s secure smart home software platform, aiming to deliver U.S.-sourced, cloud-connected devices with strong security and ease of development across consumer, industrial, and enterprise markets. Texas Instruments also unveiled new automotive system-on-a-chip, radar, and Ethernet solutions designed to support higher levels of in-vehicle AI and safety, underscoring...

headline: Assessing Texas Instruments (TXN) Valuation After Recent Short Term Share Price Weakness
summary: With no single headline event driving attention, Texas Instruments (TXN) is back in focus as investors weigh its recent share performance against current financial figures and its long-established position in analog and embedded semiconductors. See our latest analysis for Texas Instruments. At a share price of $177.17, Texas Instruments has seen short term share price pressure with its 30 day share price return of a 2.94% decline. Its 5 year total shareholder return of 18.52% points to a more...

headline: Why Weebit Nano (ASX:WBT) Is Down 15.9% After Licensing ReRAM To Texas Instruments And Setting 2026 Revenue Target
summary: In December 2025, Weebit Nano Limited announced it had licensed its resistive random access memory (ReRAM) technology to Texas Instruments, enabling integration into TI’s advanced embedded processing nodes and covering IP licensing, technology transfer, and qualification for high-temperature AEC-Q100 150°C operation. This agreement not only validates Weebit Nano’s low-power, cost-effective non-volatile memory in demanding automotive-grade conditions but also coincides with the company...

headline: Hubble Network Announces Collaboration with Texas Instruments to Expand Global Bluetooth® Connectivity
summary: Today, Hubble Network, the pioneering company creating the world's first satellite-powered Bluetooth® network, announces a strategic collaboration with global semiconductor leader Texas Instruments (TI) to deliver instant global connectivity for select TI Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) chips with no specialized infrastructure required.

content.title: Hubble Network Announces Collaboration with Texas Instruments to Expand Global Bluetooth® Connectivity
